items.sentence: I think that we should force Tom to do that.
Do you think that Tom might like to do that?
I already sent an email to the support team.
I have to set my watch back. It's very fast.
I watched a movie with my friend in my room.
I don't have a great deal of money to spend.
I went out for a walk to get some fresh air.
I don't understand what you guys are saying.
I want to hire a guide who can speak French.
I use all kinds of software to study French.
Tom is approximately the same height as you.
Tom invited his friends over for a barbecue.
Tom has written a lot of interesting things.
Tom has lost his keys three times this week.
Tom had a pen, but he didn't have any paper.
Tom doesn't think Mary would really do that.
Tom doesn't think Mary would let John drive.
Tom doesn't plan on going anywhere tomorrow.
Tom doesn't care whether we help him or not.
Tom didn't want to spend any time with Mary.
Tom asked Mary to meet him under the bridge.
Tom and Mary are currently living in Boston.
Tom and I are the ones who should apologize.
There are three men waiting for you outside.
I appreciate the invitation, but I can't go.
Tom is going to love the hat you bought him.
Tom is going to have to make some new rules.
Tom is going to have to do better than this.
Tom is going to have an interesting evening.
Tom is going to do what Mary told him to do.
Tom is doing everything he can to find Mary.
Tom is approximately the same weight as you.
Tom was the only person who understood Mary.
Tom was sure Mary knew he wanted to do that.
Tom was asleep on the couch when I got home.
Tom wants the rest of the money you owe him.
Tom wanted to sell everything in his garage.
Tom wanted to learn how to play the trumpet.
Tom wanted to know what caused the accident.
Tom wanted to keep things the way they were.
Tom wanted to discuss the problem with Mary.
Tom tried to talk Mary into raking his yard.
Tom stayed up all night texting his friends.
Tom should have no difficulty finding a job.
Tom says he's glad you were able to do that.
Tom paid for dinner and left the restaurant.
Tom lit the candles on Mary's birthday cake.
Tom learned how to ride a horse last summer.
Tom isn't the only one who's made a mistake.
Tom isn't going to let Mary go to the party.
